Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-PTa (XXA; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals: ZZH; UCLL1c; Derivatives: DASamP1)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Activity of the natural form was not evaluated due to a low amount of the peptide. A synthetic peptide was found to be active. The L and D-forms of the peptide showed identical antibacterial activity (D=L) against E. coli (MIC 25 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 6.25 uM), and S. aureus USA300 MRSA (MIC 3.1 uM) (Mishra B and Wang G 2012 JACS).Structure: 3D structure to be published (G Wang).SAR:  a mutant was found to be HIV active (EC50=0.63 uM) (Wang G et al. 2010 Antimicrob. Agents Chemother. 54: 1343-1346).Animal model:mouse: The same mutant also displayed in vivo efficacy in preventing biofilm formation in an animal model:mouse (Menousek J et al 2012). APD update 7/19/2012.
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Kolodziejek J, Nowotny N, Leprince J, Vaudry H, Coquet L, Jouenne T, King JD.2008
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of antimicrobial peptides from the skin secretions of the Malaysian frogs, Odorrana hosii and Hylarana picturata (Anura:Ranidae).
